page.title: 09ARDLEIGH PONIES
page.content: The hobby of {Combined carriage {driving}using{Shetland ponies}is very demanding on time and money. Teams are driven in pairs,in tandem or singly pulling two or four wheel carriages of the appropriate weight and with a driver and groom. Trials are held at places like{Badminton, Windsor and {Brighton}often against much larger animals and entrance costs can be prohibitive. Carriages can be very expensive and although the ponies themselves may not cost much initially, they have to be fed all year. Training to harness, to be handled without making a fuss, stabling, shoeing and travelling in a horse box are all aspects of this hobby.
